answers.answer: Don't know if the T3/T4 would have looked better at seven in the morning or not. Your TSH isn't real high, so I think the low Ts are not a true reflection of what is going on daily.Don't know much about the other tests, either. LOL!!It sounds like you are making progress and have a plan to make more progress. Thats great!I'll let the people who know what they're talking about discuss your tests. Just wanted to say congrats on feeling better. :-)

Thyroid hormone levels do not require a fasting blood sugar.  They don't change significantly from day to day, or whether or not you took your medication on a single day.If you are a Graves patient, you'll want your TSH levels between 1.0 and 2.0.  Doing so will bring up your FT4 slightly.But your thyroid numbers don't look all that bad.  Your A1c looks great.  Wish I could get there.  I'm on some hefty medications because of thyroid issues and they have caused considerable weight gain.  Almost makes me wish I was hyper again.Dianne
Hi friend .. I am not a lab person but wanted to wave hello!!!  C~

Hi hon.Just wrote a long post - tapped a button and deleted the whole thing. Geez - I hate that.I think you need to tweek the Armour up. Increase 1/4 grain two weeks then another 1/4 and retest.The TSH is not low enough and the free T's are off too. Should be higher at least the 3'sI'll hook up with you some time today.

Thanks for the info.  Just wasn't sure if it read like normal since I'd switched to Armour.  Was 99.9% sure this was the hypo's going on.  Hair falling out badly and getting the stiff muscles again.  But the hair could always be from the diabetes not being under control enough yet.Will talk to the dr tomorrow and have him increase the Armour.  Forgot about testing every 2 weeks instead of 6 also.

Test 4 to 6 weeks - but increase 1/4 taglet every two weeks . This way you are testing every month to monitor your levels. and you will find where you need to be.Steady pace.Bad thing on Armour........ you are stiffer in the muscles if you fall short on meds. That's just a fact. It b/c of the short life of the T3 moving around more.Keep in mind - rule of thumb - Lower TSH with Armour and higher Free T3

question: Got my numbers back from the drs and don't really know how if you read them the same on Armour as you do on a synthetic or not since they are metabolized differently.Got my blood drawn at 11:07am, fasting, water only, no Armour that morning.TSH           2.19Free T3      228  (230-420)Free T4      0.7   (0.8-1.8)Know that the TSH is too high for me and the T4 and T3 are too low, but don't know if this has to do with not taking the Armour that moring.  All you experts help, please.Had other things checked also:Triglycerides           235 =^{  down from 346 in Feb. =^)  (<150)  still way high, I know!  Working on it.Total Cholesterol     196 down from 221 in Feb.  (<200)  YEAH!!!!!LDL                       112 no change  (50 for diabetics) Don't understand this at all.  HELP!Calcium                  8.9   (range 8.6-10.2)  normalFerritin                    21  (range 10-154)  low side of normal.A1C                        6.5=135  down from 7.3 in Feb.  This is my average blood glucose level for 2 months. Still high.20 lb weight loss since Feb. visit.  La cuca racha, la cuca racha!!!  Yeah!!!!!!!!!!!Have been eating high fiber, low carb, middle of the road amount of protein. . .all per metabolic syndrome guidelines, but obviously it's not working.  Am also exercising in one form or another daily.  Walking, heavy housework, gardening, etc.  Any tips you can give me on these I would be very appreciative.Increased Metformin for diabetes.  Take mega doses of flax seed oil daily.  Also cinnamon and chromium picolonate for blood sugar stabilization.Think the low normal ferritin levels is the cause of my horrible RLS.  Am going to have to eat higher iron foods to try and get this up.  Look out spinach salad, here I come!! lolAlso saw my gyn and he said all my tissue samples and tests were absolutely normal.  Showed no signs of anything wrong.  Since switching to Armour the abdominal pain and swelling are gone.  Took about one week after the switch and I felt like a different person with no abdominal pain, constipation, or bloating with gas.He also started me on a new med, Norethindrone 5mg, to help lengthen the time between Aunt Flo visits, shorten her stay, and make them more bearable.  Just started it, but am in hopes of it really working.  Return in 6 months if no change or only improvement.Sorry so long, but thanks for any help you can give me.Dac
title: HI ALL!!  Need help with these numbers.
